_description: A charm against a wound — fourteen lines in couplets

BLAdd33996.First Lines:
I coniure þe wounde blyueby þe vertu of þe woundes
                    fyue…
BLAdd33996.Last Lines:
Of þe sone & of þe holy gost&sey þys þre
                    tymes & þryes pater noster & aue
BLAdd33996.Editions:
Heinrich,  Fritz. 
             Ein mittelenglisches Medizinbuch.
         Halle: N. Neimeyer, 1896: 162-3.

HunHM64.First Lines:
I coniure the wonde blyve by the vertu of the wondes fyveOf
                    Ihesu cryste bothe godde and manWhyche ryght he vs from helle
                    wanne…
HunHM64.Last Lines:
…In the name of the fader of mygthis mosteOf the sonne and of
                    the home of the holy gooste
HunHM64.Note:
Three couplets, the second and third separated by prose passage; written
                    as prose.
HunHM64.Editions:
Hanna,  Ralph,
                        ed.  
             “The Index of Middle English Verse and Huntington Library Collections: A
                Checklist of Addenda.” 
             Publications of the Bibliographical Society of America
         74 (1980): 235-58: 242.
